heisigStory: The notion of guarding something easily brings to mind the image of someone standing guard, like the royal soldiers in front of Buckingham Palace or the Pope's Swiss Guard. The whole idea of hiring guards is that they should stick like glue to your house to protect it from unwanted prowlers. So go ahead and glue a guard to your house in imagination.
koohiiStory1: A GUARD is usually "glued" to the house he watches.
koohiiStory2: A guard provides a measure of security to those under a roof.
kunYomi: まも.る、まも.り、もり、-もり、かみ
myStory: bảo vệ. đo đạc nhà để bảo vệ nhà
readingExamples: 守備 (しゅび), 保守 (ほしゅ), 攻守 (こうしゅ), 守る (まも.る), 守 (もり)
words:
守衛(しゅえい): security guard, doorkeeper
守備(しゅび): defense
保守(ほしゅ): conservative, maintaining
守る(まもる): protect, obey, guard, abide (by the rules)
留守番(るすばん): care-taking, caretaker, house-watching
留守(るす): being away, be out (of one´s home or office)
